Docs.typeparam: The type of items in the read-only memory buffer.
Docs.param: The read-only memory buffer.
Docs.summary: Creates a instance from a .
Docs.returns: A memory block that represents the same memory as the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method must be used with extreme caution. <xref:System.ReadOnlyMemory%601> is used to represent immutable data and other memory that is not meant to be written to. <xref:System.Memory%601> instances created by this method should not be written to. The purpose of this method is to allow variables typed as <xref:System.Memory%601> but only used for reading to store a <xref:System.ReadOnlyMemory%601>.

Docs.returns: The read-only reference to the structure of type .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
`T` cannot contain pointers or references. It is checked at runtime in order to preserve type safety.
This method is supported only on platforms that support misaligned memory access or when the memory block is aligned by other means.

Docs.typeparam: The type of the source span.
The type of the target span.
Docs.param: The source slice to convert.
Docs.summary: Casts a read-only span of one primitive type to a read-only span of another primitive type.
Docs.returns: The converted read-only span.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Neither `TFrom` nor `TTo` can contain pointers or references. `TFrom` and `TTo` are checked at runtime in order to preserve type safety.
This method is supported only on platforms that support misaligned memory access or when the memory block is aligned by other means.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Span<TTo> Cast<TFrom,TTo> (Span<TFrom> span) where TFrom : struct where TTo : struct;

.method public static hidebysig valuetype System.Span`1<!!TTo> Cast<struct .ctor (class System.ValueType) TFrom, struct .ctor (class System.ValueType) TTo>(valuetype System.Span`1<!!TFrom> span) cil managed
Public Shared Function Cast(Of TFrom As Structure, TTo As Structure) (span As Span(Of TFrom)) As Span(Of TTo)
static member Cast : Span<'From (requires 'From : struct)> -> Span<'o (requires 'o : struct)> (requires 'From : struct and 'o : struct)

Docs.typeparam: The type of the source span.
The type of the target span.
Docs.param: The source slice to convert.
Docs.summary: Casts a span of one primitive type to a span of another primitive type.
Docs.returns: The converted span.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Neither `TFrom` nor `TTo` can contain pointers or references. `TFrom` and `TTo` are checked at runtime in order to preserve type safety.
If the sizes of the two types are different, the cast combines or splits values, which leads to a change in length.
For example, if `TFrom` is <xref:System.Int64>, the `ReadOnlySpan<Int64>` contains a single value, 0x0100001111110F0F, and `TTo` is <xref:System.Int32>, the resulting `ReadOnlySpan<Int32>` contains two values. The values are 0x11110F0F and 0x01000011 on a little-endian architecture, such as x86. On a big-endian architecture, the order of the two values is reversed, i.e. 0x01000011, followed by 0x11110F0F.
As another example, if `TFrom` is <xref:System.Int32>, the `ReadOnlySpan<Int32>` contains the values of 1, 2 and 3, and `TTo` is <xref:System.Int64>, the resulting `ReadOnlySpan<Int64>` contains a single value: 0x0000000200000001 on a little-endian architecture and 0x0000000100000002 on a big-endian architecture.
This method is supported only on platforms that support misaligned memory access or when the memory block is aligned by other means.

Public Shared Function CreateFromPinnedArray(Of T) (array As T(), start As Integer, length As Integer) As Memory(Of T)
static member CreateFromPinnedArray : 'T[] * int * int -> Memory<'T>

Docs.typeparam: The type of the array.
Docs.param: The pre-pinned source array.
The index of at which to begin the memory block.
The number of items to include in the memory block.
Docs.summary: Creates a new memory buffer over the portion of the pre-pinned target array beginning at the index and consisting of items.
Docs.returns: A block of memory over the specified elements of . If is , or if and are 0, the method returns a instance of zero.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The array must already be pinned before this method is called, and that array must not be unpinned while the <xref:System.Memory%601> buffer that it returns is still in use. Calling this method on an unpinned array could result in memory corruption.

Docs.exception: is covariant, and the type of is not exactly .
The or the end index is not in the range of 0 to .

Docs.typeparam: The type of the data items.
Docs.param: A reference to data.
The number of elements that contains.
Docs.summary: Creates a new read-only span over a portion of a regular managed object.
Docs.returns: A read-only span.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method can be useful if part of a managed object represents a fixed array.
> [!WARNING] > This method should be used with caution. It is dangerous because the `length` argument is not checked. In addition, the lifetime of the returned span is not validated for safety by span-aware languages.

MemberSignature.Value: public static ref T GetReference<T> (ReadOnlySpan<T> span);
.method public static hidebysig !!T GetReference<T>(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<!!T> span) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetReference(Of T) (span As ReadOnlySpan(Of T)) As T
static member GetReference : ReadOnlySpan<'T> -> 'T

Docs.typeparam: The type of items in the span.
Docs.param: The read-only span from which the reference is retrieved.
Docs.summary: Returns a reference to the element of the read-only span at index 0.
Docs.returns: A reference to the element at index 0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the read-only span is empty, this method returns a reference to the location where the element at index 0 would have been stored. Such a reference may or may not be `null`. The returned reference can be used for pinning, but it must never be dereferenced.
